author: paulhauner
content:
For Lighthouse <:lighthouse:771417295008432198>

1. Our unstable branch is at v1.1.6, for all things except changes to fork choice (e.g., proposer boost). We expect to have the fork choice changes merged within 24hrs (we are in final review mode).

author: ajsutton
content:
The plan for the Kintsugi testnet is basically to run it over the Christmas period right? Asking because I think there's value in having a testnet running over Christmas and not keep trying to spin up new weekly devnets since there will be lots of holidays taken etc.

But I also don't think we're at the point where we need a "forever" public testnet.  Unsurprisingly most of the problems we're getting are either areas of active research/specification like optimistic sync which we know about or around the merge point itself.  Otherwise we seem to be running uneventfully. So testing-wise continuing to spin up short lived devnets and just keep running the merge over and over seems like what's going to flush out the most problems. Can do both of course, just confirming we aren't all thinking this is nearly ready to ship. ðŸ™‚

author: parithosh
content:
Hey everyone! 
We decided to delay Kintsugi by two days (from tuesday to thursday) to give all the teams enough time to push out bug fixes and tests. 

Looks like the agreed upon requirements to join would be CL 1.1.6 support (minus proposer boosting), EL v1.0.0-alpha5 and Kintsugi v3 (without "stable" optimistic sync).

So far the participating clients would be: 
EL: Geth, Nethermind
CL: Teku, Lighthouse, Lodestar, Nimbus, Prysm 

Genesis for the testnet should tentatively happen post lunch CEST on the 16.12 (thursday). Expect TTD to be set high to allow users to join in pre-merge. 

In case any other client team is ready, please do let me know. In case any client team wants to run a couple of their own validators this time around, lemme know and i'll set aside a mnemonic for you. 

To make it a bit easier to collect info on versions and images, I've made a small table here: https://notes.ethereum.org/@ExXcnR0-SJGthjz1dwkA1A/HkJ8Aolct/edit

Please edit the relevant information for you client - we'd use this information for the public guides, etc

author: parithosh
content: We'd take a break post Kintsugi for the holidays. So people can use the time over holidays to test and play around with it. We'd get back to weekly devnets in Jan, we'd adjust how public it is depending on what features need to be tested.
